subject: Good Friday
object: Commemorates the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ

subject: Good Friday
object: Celebration of the Passion of the Lord

subject: Good Friday
object: Worship services, prayer and vigil services, fasting, almsgiving

subject: Good Friday
object: The Friday immediately preceding Easter Sunday

subject: Good Friday
object: Passover, Christmas (which celebrates the birth of Jesus), Septuagesima, Quinquagesima, Shrove Tuesday, Ash Wednesday, Lent, Palm Sunday, Holy Wednesday, Maundy Thursday, and Holy Saturday which lead up to Easter, | Easter Sunday | (primarily), Divine Mercy Sunday, Ascension, Pentecost, Whit Monday, Trinity Sunday, Corpus Christi and Feast of the Sacred Heart which follow it. It is related to the Feast of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross, which focuses on the benefits, graces, and merits of the Cross, rather than Jesus's death.
